newsitem.title: USA: New Plan buys seven properties for $74 mln.
newsitem.headline: New Plan buys seven properties for $74 mln.

text.p: New Plan Realty Trust said Thursday it had acquired seven retail and residential properties from various sellers for $74 million, bringing the trust's investments to $100 million for 12 properties in its fiscal first quarter, began August 1.
The trust also said it has agreed in principle with sellers to acquire another $30 million in properties.
The purchases include real estate in Las Vegas and Baton Rouge, La., that extends the trust's holdings into Nevada and Louisiana for the first time.

The company said the seven properties include shopping centers in Las Vegas, St. Petersburg, Fla., and Dillsburg, Pa., three garden apartment communities in Baton Rouge, and a garden apartment property in Evansville, Ind.
